item.title: Ladies Campaign
item.description:
Welcome to the Ladies Campaign Players Journal.
Players Journal site (this Site): https://scottrgall.github.io/ladies-campaign/
DnD Beyond Campaign Link: https://www.dndbeyond.com/campaigns/join/73949793317632351

item.title: House Rules
item.description: Everyone uses Point Buy Player Point Buy Worksheet Everyone starts with 27 points. One ability should intentionally be weaker than the others. Full rebuilds are allowed until the start of Session 2. After this it will have to work narratively with DM approval after this. I'm not opposed to character changes but I'd like to avoid destabilizing the party in the process.

item.title: Player Point Buy Worksheet
item.description: Point Buy Stats Strength is crushing a tomato. Dexterity is dodging the tomato when someone throws it at you. Constitution is eating a rotten one and not being ill because of it. Intelligence is knowing a tomato is a fruit Wisdom is knowing not to put it in a fruit salad. Charisma is convincing people to buy your tomato-based fruit salad.D&D 5e Point Buy Cost Table Point buy in D&D 5e gives you 27 points to spend on your six ability scores before racial bonuses.You cannot raise a score above 15 before racial bonuses. Once the 27 points are spent, you apply racial bonuses, pick your class, and you are done. This ensures everyone starts balanced while still choosing what their character is good at and where they are weaker.When creating your character in D&D Beyond, please follow these steps exactly. Create or open your character. Go to the Abilities section. Under Generation Method, select Point Buy. You will see all ability scores start at 8 and a pool of 27 points. Use the plus and minus buttons to raise or lower scores. You cannot raise any score above 15 before racial bonuses. Once you have spent all 27 points, stop. Apply your racial bonuses automatically when prompted. Do not roll for stats and do not use standard array. That’s it. If you get stuck, stop and we will finish it together in Session 0.

item.title: Session 0
item.description:
Table Setup and ExpectationsTechnical DND Beyond Setup for each player: Install DnD Beyond App on phones/iPad (if desired) Setup DnD Beyond Accounts Walk through of Character Creation on DnD Beyond Website
Character Concepts From Each Player
Player Point Buy Worksheet

item.title: Character Concepts From Each Player
item.description: 4) Character Pitch (one sentence) “I am a __ who __.”Examples: “I am a runaway acolyte who still hears my god in my dreams.” “I am a practical hunter who does not trust magic, but needs it.” DM TODO: add results to Player Characters (PCs) 5) Three Tags Pick 3: Protector Survivor Scholar Trickster Zealot Outcast Leader Caretaker Daredevil Loyalist Rebel Greedy (but redeemable) 6) Spotlight Preference Circle one: I like being central sometimes I prefer supporting others I want a mix

item.title: Table Setup and Expectations
item.description: 1) Campaign Tone Circle one: Cozy heroic Classic heroic with danger Dark fairy tale with hope Grim and morally messy 2) Party Contract Answer yes or no: We are a cooperative party (no sabotage): Y / N Secrets between characters are allowed if they create story not conflict: Y / N PvP is only allowed with prior consent: Y / N Party splits will be kept short and rare: Y / N 3) Safety and Boundaries Non-Negotiable: No harm to children No sexual violence of any kind Party Discussion: Fade to black for romance Avoid torture detail Other: ___
